Docs.summary: Provides implicit management for child messaging activities.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CorrelationScope activity maintains an implicit <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationHandle> that is only visible to child activities. When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationScope.CorrelatesWith%2A> property is set by the user, it will be used as the CorrelationScope implicit handle. In the case of nested CorrelationScope, children of the inner scope cannot access implicit handle of the outer scope.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a CorrelationScope. This example creates a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Sequence> and adds a CorrelationScope (among other activites). The CorrelationScope contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Sequence> that is composed of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ReceiveReply> activity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is read-only at runtime. If the value is set at runtime, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.
The runtime uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationInitializer.CorrelationHandle%2A> for correlation if it is present, otherwise the **CorrelatesWith** property of the messaging activity will be used. If both are absent, the ambient handle provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationScope> or the workflow service is used.
